channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Beyond The Bite: Exploring Electrosensitivity In Elasmobranch Predators
item.description: A recent study has discovered a relationship between body size and electrosensitivity in sandbar sharks, challenging traditional knowledge about this system.

item.title: Reclaiming “fiasco”
item.description: Usually modified with “total,” the failure might not be as bad as we fear. The origin of the word probably comes from Italian, a long time ago. The person who loses a round in a game has to buy the next bottle for the group (from: flask). Which means that there is going to be […]

item.title: ‘House Of The Dragon’ Season 2, Episode 8 Review: A Hugely Underwhelming Season Finale
item.description: House Of The Dragon Season 2 ends with a whimper, not a bang.

item.title: The Mississippi River paradox
item.description: There’s no water in that river that was there ten years ago. The boundaries have shifted in that time as well, there’s no riverbank that’s exactly where it was. And the silt and the fish have all moved too. So, what’s “the Mississippi River”? It’s a label, a placeholder, and a marker–when the Mississippi does […]

item.title: How Katie Ledecky’s ‘Syncopated Gallop’ Stroke Helps Her Swim So Fast
item.description: At the Paris Olympics, Katie Ledecky has added two gold medals to bring her career Olympic gold medal haul to nine. Here's the swimming stroke that's helped her.

item.title: Infamy
item.description: We’ve gotten so hung up on famous that it’s easy to forget that there are two kinds of renown. Being known for lowering the standards of discourse, cheating, or whining is a choice, but why would you trade your reputation to become infamous?

item.title: Slovakian Swimmer Tamara Potocka Collapses After Paris Olympics Race
item.description: Tamara Potocka from Slovakia collapsed when suffering an asthma attack after swimming a 200 meter women's individual medley heat at the 2024 Paris Olympics.

item.title: Stopping a runaway train
item.description: It feels urgent because it is. But by the time the train is running away, it might be too late. The better strategy is to not sign up for trains that are likely to run away. The first principle of risk reduction is to figure out if you can stop it later. If you can’t, […]

item.title: Today’s NYT Mini Crossword Clues And Answers For Monday, August 5th
item.description: Looking for help with today's NYT Mini Crossword puzzle? Here are some hints and answers for the puzzle.

item.title: The tooth fairy
item.description: Make a list of things you used to believe. Fervently, certainly, completely. Things that you were sure of, but now, with the passage of time and the benefit of experience, you know to be incorrect or incomplete. Of course, it’s not just mythical creatures beloved by children. It’s our adherence to a social norm, loyalty […]
